intro: Panax cissiflorus, commonly known as the African ginseng, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring compound leaves with a serrated margin. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by red berries that contain the seeds. Its root system is fibrous and is often harvested for its medicinal properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
